meanings.definition: Make (something) neat or of the required size or form by cutting away irregular or unwanted parts.
meanings.sent1: She trimmed the bushes in the garden to make them look tidy.
meanings.sent2: The hairdresser trimmed my hair to remove split ends.
meanings.sent3: The tailor trimmed the pants so they fit perfectly, making the customer very happy.
meanings.sent4: He trimmed the story down to its essence, removing unnecessary details.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully trimmed the fat off the meat to ensure a lean dish.

meanings.definition: Decorate (something) by adding a border or ornament.
meanings.sent1: She trimmed the cake with colorful icing for the party.
meanings.sent2: The Christmas tree was beautifully trimmed with lights and ornaments.
meanings.sent3: The children trimmed the classroom with paper chains for the holiday celebration.
meanings.sent4: She trimmed the gift box with a ribbon, making it look extra special.
meanings.sent5: The bride trimmed her veil with delicate lace for the wedding.

meanings.definition: Adjust (sails) to take advantage of the wind.
meanings.sent1: The sailor trimmed the sails to catch the strong breeze.
meanings.sent2: They trimmed the boat's sails to sail smoothly across the lake.
meanings.sent3: The captain trimmed the sails expertly, impressing the crew with his skill.
meanings.sent4: She trimmed the sails just right, guiding the boat through the rough waters.
meanings.sent5: The crew quickly trimmed the sails to navigate the storm safely.
